sections.title: Introduction (Wide Shot)
sections.content: Hey, I’m Jihad Al Sayed. In this video, we’re covering one of the most important theorems in linear algebra — the Invertible Matrix Theorem. This gives us multiple ways to tell if a square matrix is invertible.

sections.title: The Invertible Matrix Theorem (IMT)
sections.content: A matrix is invertible if and only if it satisfies a long list of equivalent conditions. That means any one of them being true implies all the others are too.

sections.title: Key Equivalent Conditions
sections.math: \text{A is invertible} \iff \text{RREF of A is I} \iff \det(A) \neq 0 \iff \text{Columns are linearly independent}

sections.title: Implication: Ax = b Has Unique Solution
sections.math: A\vec{x} = \vec{b} \Rightarrow \text{Unique solution exists if A is invertible}

sections.title: Recap
sections.content: We walked through the Invertible Matrix Theorem and showed multiple ways to check if a matrix is invertible. These tools make it easier to analyze systems, transformations, and algorithms.
